    • Method Detail

      • rememberGameData

        public void rememberGameData()
        Description copied from class: GorillasTestAdapterMinimal
        all the game data is stored. This method is needed to restore the game data after the testing. The term game data denotes every information, which the game saves between different runs (like settings and the chosen player names).
        Overrides:
        rememberGameData in class GorillasTestAdapterMinimal

      • restoreGameData

        public void restoreGameData()
        Description copied from class: GorillasTestAdapterMinimal
        restores the saved game data. This method is called after the tests. It should make sure that
        Overrides:
        restoreGameData in class GorillasTestAdapterMinimal

      • createRandomMap

        public void createRandomMap(int frameWidth,
                            int frameHeight,
                            int gorillaWidth,
                            int gorillaHeight)
        This method should create a new RANDOM map. The map should consist of the coordinates of the left and the right gorilla and the upper left edges of the buildings of the skyline. The gorilla positions should mark the center of each gorilla. The buildings of the skyline are rectangular, and not higher than frameHeight minus 100. Important: The y coordinate of the gorillas and the buildings should be denoted with the y axis pointing downwards, as slick demands this. The left gorilla has to be placed on the first, second or third building from the left. Accordingly, the right gorilla has to be placed on the first, second or third building from the right. Gorillas should be placed in the middle of a building and stand on the building. The map should be remembered as the current one. Hence, getBuildingCoordinates(), getLeftGorillaCoordinate() and getRightGorillaCoordinate() should after an invocation of this method return the values of the newly created map. The wind should not blow at all in the map.
        Parameters:
        frameWidth - the width of the frame/screen of the gorillas game
        frameHeight - the height of the frame/screen of the gorillas game

      • createCustomMap

        public void createCustomMap(int paneWidth,
                            int paneHeight,
                            int yOffsetCity,
                            java.util.ArrayList<org.newdawn.slick.geom.Vector2f> buildingCoordinates,
                            org.newdawn.slick.geom.Vector2f leftGorillaCoordinate,
                            org.newdawn.slick.geom.Vector2f rightGorillaCoordinate)
        creates a map, which is NOT RANDOM based on the given parameters
        Parameters:
        paneWidth - the width of the frame/window/pane of the game
        paneHeight - the height of the frame/window/pane of the game
        yOffsetCity - the top y offset of the city
        buildingCoordinates - the building coordinates of the city skyline
        leftGorillaCoordinate - the coordinate of the left gorilla
        rightGorillaCoordinate - the coordinate of the right gorilla

      • startCurrrentMap

        public void startCurrrentMap()
        the current, which was created with createRandomMap(int,int,int,int) of createCustomMap(int,int,int,ArrayList,Vector2f,Vector2f) should be set as current map in the game, if the game is in GamePlayState

      • getBuildingCoordinates

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.newdawn.slick.geom.Vector2f> getBuildingCoordinates()
        should return the building coordinates of the current map
        Returns:
        all the upper left corner's coordinates of the buildings of the current map, ordered from left to right

        adds a highscore to the highscore list
        Parameters:

        numberOfRounds - the number of rounds played
        roundsWon - the number of rounds the player has one
        bananasThrown - the number of bananas the player has thrown

      • resetHighscore

        public void resetHighscore()
        Resets the highscores. Alle entries are deleted and @see getHighscoreCount() should return 0.

      • getHighscoreCount

        public int getHighscoreCount()
        Returns the numnber of highscore entries currently stored.
        Returns:
        number of highscore entries

      • getNameAtHighscorePosition

        public java.lang.String getNameAtHighscorePosition(int position)
        Returns the player name of the highscore entry at the passed position. The best highscore should be at position 0. See the specification in the task assignment for the definition of best highscore. Positions that are invalid should return null.
        Parameters:
        position - position of the highscore entry
        Returns:
        playername of the highscore entry at the passed position or null if position is invalid

      • getRoundsPlayedAtHighscorePosition

        public int getRoundsPlayedAtHighscorePosition(int position)
        Returns the number of rounds played in total of the highscore entry a the passed position The best highscore should be at position 0. See the specification in the task assignment for the definition of best highscore. Positions that are invalid should return -1.
        Parameters:
        position - position of the highscore entry
        Returns:
        number of rounds played in total of the highscore entry at the passed position or -1 if position is invalid

      • getRoundsWonAtHighscorePosition

        public int getRoundsWonAtHighscorePosition(int position)

        Parameters:
        position - position of the highscore entry
        Returns:
        number of rounds won of the highscore entry at the passed position or -1 if position is invalid

        Returns:

      • getPlayer1Score

        public int getPlayer1Score()
        if the game is in the GamePlayState, this method should return the current score of player one
        Returns:
        the current score of player one or -1 if the game is not in the GamePlayState

      • getPlayer2Score

        if the game is in the GamePlayState, this method should return the current score of player two
        Returns:

      • isPlayer1Turn

        public boolean isPlayer1Turn()
        if the game is in the GamePlayState, this method should return whether it is the turn of player one If it is the turn of a player is decided on the fact if the player is currently able to parameterize a shot.
        Returns:
        true if it is the turn of player one, false if it is the turn of player two or the game is not in GamePlayState or it is not the turn of anyone

      • isPlayer2Turn

        public boolean isPlayer2Turn()
        if the game is in the GamePlayState, this method should return whether it is the turn of player two If it is the turn of a player is decided on the fact if the player is currently able to parameterize a shot.
        Returns:
        true if it is the turn of player two, false if it is the turn of player one or the game is not in GamePlayState or it is not the turn of anyone
